result.author: By MORGAN SMITH
result.title: Now in Driver’s Seat, Patrick Credits Grass Roots
result.opening: Dan Patrick, the radio host and state senator, credits his success to popular support, but his front-runner status has been built on lessons learned navigating old-school politics.

result.author: By RABEEA TAHIR
result.title: Afraid It Was Missing the Boat, a City Tries to Catch the Bus
result.opening: Arlington, Tex., one of the largest American cities without public transportation, approved a commuter bus line last year, and supporters hope it will change attitudes there.

result.author: By DYLAN LOEB McCLAIN
result.title: Tasting Early Success, Only to Walk Away
result.opening: Ilya Gurevich and Tal Shaked won the World Junior Chess Championships in the 1990s, but neither of them pursued chess careers as adults.

result.title: The Victims of Fort Hood
result.opening: A gunman killed three people and wounded 16 others before killing himself at Fort Hood, the same sprawling Army base in Texas where in 2009 an officer went on a shooting rampage that left 13 people dead.

result.author: By DEB AMLEN
result.title: At Times
result.opening: A puzzle by Patrick Berry that I enjoyed, at times.

result.author: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
result.title: Archbishop Says He Plans to Sell $2 Million Home
result.opening: A group of Catholics in the archdiocese in Atlanta had asked that Archbishop Wilton D. Gregory sell the more than 6,000-square-foot home in keeping with the tone of austerity set by Pope Francis.

result.author: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS
result.title: Ethics Chief in Georgia Wins Suit Over Ouster
result.opening: Jurors have awarded the former director of Georgia’s ethics commission $700,000 after ruling in her favor in a lawsuit in which she said her salary had been cut and a deputy removed for investigating complaints against Gov. Nathan Deal.

result.author: By THE NEW YORK TIMES
result.title: Blast Near Falluja Kills 17 Iraq Troops
result.opening: The soldiers, part of an army convoy patrolling Albu Hadeed, near Falluja, were attacked by gunmen from the Islamic State of Iraq and Syria militant group, security officials said.
